intro: Sedum roanense, commonly known as Roan's stonecrop, is a species of flowering plant in the family Crassulaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of western North America, particularly in areas with rocky or alpine habitats. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the summer. It typically grows in open, sunny environments and is adapted to withstand harsh, arid conditions. Sedum roanense is often found in meadows, rocky outcrops, and along stream banks at high elevations.
